reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Inclusive actions for improving women’s social status through skills, employment and economic development (INSWEED)

description.narrative: 1. Project: 12052 Inclusive actions for improving women’s social status through skills, employment and economic development (INSWEED) 2. Project area and Country: Siem Reap province, Cambodia 3. Project justification: Women have fewer productive emplo yment and decent work opportunities in Cambodia. Major challenges to be addressed include limited access to technical and vocational training that enable them to access job opportunities or promote women entrepreneurship. Furthermore, TVET is not popular a mong youth due to lack of information, and TVET services are not responding to labour market needs. Many Cambodians, especially youth, migrate abroad to seek for better livelihood. Poverty combined with the lack of information and education makes rural peo ple vulnerable to illegal migration, trafficking and sexual exploitation in the destination countries. The project area is highly affected by migration.4. The main objective and the expected results: The main objective of the project is that adolescent gir ls and their families in the targeted areas are economically empowered and become more active members in their local communities. This will be accomplished through increased access to relevant and quality TVET services for adolescent girls and youth.The pr oject will also enhance adolescent girls’ and women’s access to jobs and/or establish micro businesses and improve their vocational and soft skills. The project will work with the parents and local communities to increase their support to girls’ educ ation and participation in TVET. Furthermore, FCA will contribute its expertise to enhance the quality of TVET services. 5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 250 youth access to skill training or TVET, 15 TVET teachers, 1,600 members of saving groups, and 1,00 0 community members benefitting from community awareness Duty bearers: Ministries of Labour and Vocational Training (MoLVT), Education Youth and Sport (MoEYS); National Employment Agency (NEA), local authorities at district and commune levels6. Implementin g partner: FCA and Cambodian Women’s Crisis Center (CWCC) in a consortium
